DOC.HEAD: URGENT
Gorbachev Voices Support for Romanian People's `Just Cause'
With PM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: President Mikhail S. Gorbachev and Soviet legislators today voiced support for the popular uprising in Romania. During today's session of the Soviet Congress, Gorbachev, who chaired the proceedings, periodically doubled as news announcer and read aloud the latest reports from Romania as the regime of dictator Nicolae Ceausescu toppled. When he announced that Romanian Radio was reporting Ceausescu had been arrested, the Congress broke into applause. He then proposed a resolution to send Romanians a vote of support for the changes there, and the motion passed overwhelmingly. ``At this crucial period for the fate of Romania,'' the resolution said, ``the Second Congress of People's Deputies offers its decisive support for the just cause of the people of Romania.'' ``We declare to the citizens of Romania our traditional feeling of friendship and good-neighborliness and stress our sincere striving for close cooperation in the interest of socialism and peace,'' it concluded. Earlier in the day, the Congress passed a resolution expressing serious concern over the dramatic events in Romania and called for a peaceful end to the unrest. The first resolution was adopted after Gorbachev announced that information received from Soviet diplomats in Romania indicated that the situation had seriously worsened overnight. He did not elaborate. That resolution expressed hopes for a peaceful settlement of Romania's problems ``in the spirit of tolerance, humaneness and respect for human rights.''
